verses.text: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho. And the LORD showed him all the land: Gilead as far as Dan,
verses.comment: Stays close to MT (Masoretic Text); 'to the top of Pisgah' is literal.

verses.text: and all Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the western sea,
verses.comment: ‘Western sea’ is the literal Hebrew phrase for the Mediterranean.

verses.text: the Negeb, and the Plain, that is, the Valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, as far as Zoar.
verses.comment: 'City of palm trees' is a literal rendering used for Jericho; see also Judges 1:16.

verses.text: And the LORD said to him, 'This is the land that I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, I will give it to your descendants; I have let you see it with your eyes, but you shall not cross over there.'
verses.comment: Rendered 'descendants' for literal 'seed' in Hebrew, matching modern usage.

verses.text: So Moses the servant of the LORD died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Servant of the LORD' is a key title; 'according to the word of the LORD' is literal (see MT).

verses.text: And He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab, opposite Beth-peor; but no one knows the place of his burial to this day.
verses.comment: He = the LORD, as in traditional reading; 'to this day' indicates the time of writing.

verses.text: Moses was one hundred and twenty years old when he died. His eye was undimmed, and his vigor was unabated.
verses.comment: Literal word order followed; 'vigor was unabated' translates a Hebrew idiom meaning 'his strength was not gone.'

verses.text: And the people of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days. Then the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were ended.
verses.comment: Phrase structure mirrors Hebrew; 'wept ... thirty days' follows word order.

verses.text: Now Joshua the son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom, because Moses had laid his hands on him. So the people of Israel obeyed him, and they did as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: 'Spirit of wisdom' is literal; 'laid his hands on him' matches MT.

verses.text: And there has not arisen a prophet since in Israel like Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face,
verses.comment: 'Face to face' is literal, referring to direct, unique relationship.

verses.text: none like him for all the signs and the wonders that the LORD sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his servants and to all his land,
verses.comment: Maintains sequence and parallelism of Hebrew.

verses.text: and for all the mighty power and all the great deeds of terror that Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
verses.comment: 'Deeds of terror' is literal; 'in the sight of all Israel' matches Hebrew usage emphasising Moses' public actions.
